ARABIC: فَخَرَجَ مِنْهَا خَآئِفًا يَتَرَقَّبُ قَالَ رَبِّ نَجِّنِى مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So he left there fearful and on his guard, saying, 'My Lord, rescue me from the people of the wrongdoers!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So he left the city, fearful and hesitant, (and) prayed: "O Lord, deliver me from these wicked people."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Soon after hearing this Moses departed in a state of fear, looking around as one in apprehension and prayed: "My Lord, deliver me from these unjust people."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: So he left the city afraid and cautious, saying, "Lord, protect me against the unjust people".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So he left the city in fear, waiting to see what happens; he said, “My Lord! Rescue me from the unjust people.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So he escaped from there, looking about in a state of fear. He said: "My Lord! Save me from the people who are wrongdoers!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So he went forth therefrom, fearing, awaiting, (and) he said: My Lord! deliver me from the unjust people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So he departed therefrom, fearful and vigilant; he said, 'My Lord, deliver me from the people of the evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So he escaped from thence, fearing, vigilant. He said: My Lord! Deliver me from the wrongdoing folk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: So Moses departed from the city, fearful and vigilant, and prayed, "My Lord, save me from these unjust people."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So he went forth from thence fearing, looking abcut. He said: my Lord! deliver me from the wrong-doing people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So he left the city, fearful and vigilant. He said, ‘My Lord! Deliver me from the wrongdoing lot.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He therefore got away therefrom, looking about, in a state of fear. He prayed "O my Lord! save me from people given to wrong-doing."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So he escaped from there, looking about in a state of fear. He said: "My Lord! Save me from the people who are Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers)!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So he left, fearful and vigilant, saying: 'My Lord, save me from the harmdoing nation'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So he left, fearful and vigilant. He said, “My Lord, deliver me from the wrongdoing people.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So he left it, fearful and anticipating [apprehension]. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [28:21] So he departed from it, fearful, vigilant, lest any of the pursuers catch up with him, or [in the hope] that God might rescue him. He said, ‘My Lord, deliver me from the evildoing people’, Pharaoh’s people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So he escaped from thence) from the city, (fearing, vigilant) waiting and looking behind him expecting to be hunted down and arrested. (He said) at this point: (My Lord! Deliver me from the wrong-doing folk) the people of Egypt.
